## Tutorials 1. [Arduino intro & useful links](/posts/tutorials/arduino-intro-and-links.html) 1. [Intro to Arduino code](/posts/tutorials/intro.html) 1. [Basic Electronics Concepts](/posts/tutorials/basic-electronics-concepts.html) 1. [Electronics Class](/posts/tutorials/electronics-class.html) 1. [Sensor Modules and Thingspeak](/posts/tutorials/intro-to-sensor-modules-and-thingspeak.html) 1. [Basic Data Analysis with Python and Matlab](/posts/tutorials/python-matlab-basics.html) 1. [Water and Energy Balances](/posts/tutorials/water-and-energy-balances.html) 1. [Psychrometric Chart and Evaporative cooling](/posts/tutorials/psychrometric-chart-and-evaporative-cooling.html) 1. [Soldering and Wires](/code/2022/05/18/soldering-and-wires) ## Resources #### Equipment Click for a [list of the main components](/content/equipment) used in this course. #### Github Make an account on [Github](https://github.com). Create a repository called "agrotech" or whatever you else want to call it. You can upload to this repository your code, data, diagrams, pictures, markdown, etc. In the end of the semester you will upload your project report as a Jupyter Notebook file. From now on, your main Github page can be your "geek face" on the internet. Make a clean and simple `readme.md`, telling the world who you are and what you do. #### Jupyter Notebook The easiest way to install Python (+ Jupyter Notebook, Spyder, PyCharm, JupyterLab, etc) on any OS is to download [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual). Jupyter Notebook is a versatile environment that allows you to write code and documentation in one single file, taking advantage of Markdown. Click for a [short](https://devhints.io/markdown) and a [long](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet) markdown cheat sheet. #### Fritzing [Fritzing](https://fritzing.org/download/) is a nice software that lets you easily draw your own circuits and diagrams. ![](http://troybaverstock.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/arduino-servo-button-red-green-RGB-LED-wiring-diagram.png) ### Very useful links * Oregon State's OPEnS Lab. [Github](https://github.com/OPEnSLab-OSU/OPEnS-Lab-Home/wiki)
